availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Mary J. Brown (Jessamine County, KY, hotel keeper)

body.p: Nicholasville, Jessamine County, Kentucky, hotel keeper. Kentucky native. Married to Thomas J. Brown. Mother of Henrietta Brown, Virginia Brown, Victoria Brown, Margaret Brown, and Jefferson Brown. Resident in Jessamine County in 1850. Owned twenty enslaved persons in Jessamine County in 1850. Hotel keeper in Nicholasville in 1860. Owned twenty-five enslaved persons in Nicholasville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
